meanings.definition: An endowed church office granting a stipend to a clergyman.
meanings.sent1: The bishop received a benefices for his dedicated service to the church.
meanings.sent2: The benefices of the parish priest included a small house and a monthly salary.
meanings.sent3: The benefices of the church treasurer were so generous that he could afford to buy a new car.
meanings.sent4: In the world of church benefices, the position of archdeacon was considered the most prestigious.
meanings.sent5: The benefices of the chaplain were so abundant that he could afford to donate to charity regularly.

meanings.definition: A church living with an income attached.
meanings.sent1: The small village church was a benefices that supported the local priest.
meanings.sent2: The benefices of the cathedral provided a comfortable livelihood for the bishop.
meanings.sent3: The benefices of the church were so fruitful that the priest could afford to renovate the building.
meanings.sent4: The benefices of the abbey were like a steady stream of financial support for the monks.
meanings.sent5: The benefices of the parish were crucial for the financial stability of the church community.

meanings.definition: A church office or position that yields an income.
meanings.sent1: The benefices of the church secretary included managing the finances of the parish.
meanings.sent2: The bishop appointed a new clergyman to the benefices of the vacant church office.
meanings.sent3: The benefices of the church treasurer were so substantial that he could afford to travel abroad.
meanings.sent4: The benefices of the archdeacon were like a steady source of income for his family.
meanings.sent5: The benefices of the chaplain were essential for the financial stability of the church.
